title: Drawing, 1780–1800
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray watercolor, graphite on off-white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in upper right: 104, corrected into 174, and 10
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Three rows: above: two half figures, at left an owl, at right a dragon and a band motif. Center: in the center is a vase with, at left, a winged animal with two heads, the half figure of an eagle at right supporting a festoon hanging from a rosette, in the center of the cornice. Below: the head of a stag, in the center, and two fantastic birds supporting drapery festoons springing from a ring in the center. On verso: a leaf.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, 1780–1800. Pen and black ink, brush and gray watercolor, graphite on off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-4611.
